author: Tomas Garro
title: Multilingual resources

assessments.note: The expansion of Cardano-related content to non-English speaking communities is fully in line with Cardano's ideas. One of Cardano's main objectives is to be a protocol used by hundreds of millions of people and this will inevitably require a lot of information in several languages. There is a huge demand for this, including in Catalyst itself, because currently the vast majority of content related to Catalyst is in English and if we want to guarantee fair and considerable participation we need to propose solutions for translation.

To reach the whole world, multi-lingual approach is a must. However, as mentioned in the comments, what should be translated is the first question to be answered.

I don't see the "broadness" as an issue. After all, this is a Challenge, not a solution.

One approach would be to only translate what goes on the landing page: https://cardano.ideascale.com/a/dtd/Project-Catalyst-Landing-Page/341718-48088

Another approach would be to "organize globally" so that the local / regional / continental groups can deal in their own language(s) but the global collaboration still takes place in English, with representatives of the aforementioned groups functioning as "messengers between languages".
Making sure internationalization is top of mind across a growing is ultimately a requirement if we plan on becoming the de-facto world banking system.
The challenge aims to accelerate the adoption of Cardano worldwide. Decentralization will be enabled also in countries in which the uneducated population does not have access to resources in english.

Great proposal, the need to onboard multicultural agencies, user and organization is an integral part of the Cardano mission. The official page for Cardano already brings a multinational and multilinguistic  platform for all to share ideas, questions and resources. An expansion of this asset could well benefit the mission at large by facilitating the base foundation of the Cardano exosystem.
I think this is important to entice crypto "virgin" markets into Cardano, although English should always remain the global and common language of Cardano

This proposal aligns well with Cardano's mission.
While English is the current Lingua Franca of the world, it is not the case in all regions and communities.
It is in Project Catalyst's vision to include as many and as diverse a community can possibly get.
It is important that we realise such an inclusion early on to maximise involvement and thus opportunity.

Definitely important to create multilingual resources. The estimated funding of USD 75.000 looks reasonable. For qualifying this to be a Challenge Setting, I would suggest to look closer, which global synergies and/or platform approaches can be created.
However multilingual resources are essential for the growth of the project, creating challenge for that doesn't seem much important at this stage.
completely agree Cardano ecosystem needs to reach devs/builders in more languages.
It is a completely viable challenge, there are already many community members doing voluntary translation of articles, creation of videos, courses, software translation, among others.
Yes, the community is able to propose solutions for this. But certain decisions need to be taken before we can tackle this (the scope, the tools, the process, the roles, the incentives etc).
The diversity of the catalyst community is primed for this undertaking
Rewarding volunteers for translating contents is already being done by the ambassadors programs by IOHK
It appears that a basic form already exist and the substructure is there to build upon, the community has what it needs to welcome improvement to that challenge.

I can imagine a high demand from the community.
The fund requested is realistic.
To improve the proposal's clarity, a sequence of languages to be translated to is advised.

I assume that we have all the required capabilities within the community. I would suggest to aim for some kind of global content management for creating high-quality core-content that can be localized and complemented, so that we are not re-creating everything everywhere (typically with much less quality). This can definitely justify the launching such a Challenge Setting for Fund 6.
The community will be able to address the challenge, monetizing for resource creating doesn't look much feasible
These metrics are exactly what you would want to gauge success.

I believe that the amount of material produced in other languages is a plausible metric, but I think it is important to add more tangible metrics. Number of non-English speakers entering the Cardano community is somewhat subjective, this metric can be distorted for external reasons like a bull market during the execution of the proposals. A time horizon metric would be nice as weel.
They are good for the initial proposal but should be reviewed and re-considered after the aforementioned decisions have been made.
Proposed key metrics are already good enough
It's clear that via a simple market research / statistical analysis the ROI can be evaluated against the number of people reached by the influencers that could be rewarded accordingly.

The metrics appear to be limited in approach and more information of what can be included in these instructional courses or presentations would warrant a more powerful effect to determine if the proposal can deliver on the solutions and what steps are going to be taken to succeed. Good solution, good luck.
The metrics are relevant, perhaps a bit vague e.g. "A sense of community and conversations. Having people around to talk with." how is this measured ?
It is unclear how many languages are aimed to be translated to. Which languages would you start with and why?
Can not find any proposed metrics, but I do not doubt that this can be measured tangibly. Needs more thoughts before making further steps.
Attracting and creating a bigger eco-system can be measured definitely as mentioned in the proposal

importance: Multilingual platforms will allow non english speakers to learn about Cardano and increase its adoption worldwide.
success:
Increased adoption and community engagement of non english speakers.
Increased amount of resources in a variety of languages.
